intro: Kochia decipiens, commonly known as the impostor kochia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble small flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of wax, which helps reduce water loss. Kochia decipiens is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within one growing season.
